result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelia M. Scoville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay fines, costs, and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Expungement under 973.015 if successful with probation.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
 Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Submit DNA sample.
No direct/indirect contact with Greg Jung.

records.addlTxt:
10:41 a.m. Defendant Angelia M. Scoville in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 15CF380 Ct 1 w/h sentence: Probation w/conditions. DRI 15CF380 ct 2, 15CF416 and 15CF424.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF380 Count 1 Possess of Methamphetamine - Felony - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF380 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
Dismissed and Read In 15CF380 ct 2, 15CF416 and 15CF424

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing recommendations to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint recommendation.  

BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION****
15CF380 Count 1:  W/H Sentence
24 mo Probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
 Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Pay fine $200 fine + costs + DNA surcharge.
Submit DNA sample.
No direct/indirect contact with Greg Jung.
Expungement under 973.015 if successful with probation.

Defendant Angelia M. Scoville in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Angelia M. Scoville in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
